title: Santos steps on gas with $2.2b ConocoPhillips buy
text:
The company told the ASX on Monday the deal should lift earnings per share by about 16 per cent in 2020.

Santos also said the transaction will increase pro-forma production by about 25 per cent and reduce its forecast 2020 free cash flow break-even oil price by about $US4 a barrel.

Mr Gallagher said Santos intended to manage gearing within its stated operating range and is aiming to sell down equity in Darwin LNG and Barossa to 40 to 50 per cent to ''create alignment between joint venture participants as well as by optimising equity levels in our Western Australian assets''.

Mr Gallagher joined Santos as chief executive in early 2016 and spent the first two years aggressively lowering costs and simplifying the business to lay the foundation for a growth phase.

Santos in August posted an 89 per cent jump in first-half profit before one-time items to a record $US411 million ($607 million), buoyed by the acquisition last year of Western Australian gas producer Quadrant Energy and a discipline on costs.

Santos was in deep strife after being hit hard by the slump in oil prices in 2014 to 2016, but has bounbced back strongly.

There has been a $US442 million turnaround in underlying profit since the first half of 2016. Free cash flow jumped 74 per cent in the first half of 2019 to $US638 million.

In August, Santos reduced its estimate for the oil price at which it will break even this year to about $US31 a barrel, in line with last year, despite higher capital investment in 2019. For every $US10 that the oil price is above that, Santos's annual free cash flow rises by $US300 million-$US350 million.
description: Santos CEO Kevin Gallagher is accelerating a growth phase now, after heavy cost-cutting in the early days of his tenure which started in 2016.
